title.narrative: Developing VSLA + CHILD tool to remediate child labour in cocoa areas

description.narrative: The project aims to implement a bottom-up and community-driven approach to tackle the root causes of child labour. The approach is based on the VSLA+GALS concept (Village Savings and Loan Associations + Gender Action Learning System) combined with a specific child labour remediation module (CHILD).VSLA+GALS is an efficient way to build financial resilience and empowerment of women in rural communities. By integrating a child labour component into VSLA+GALS, farmer households will be guided to prioritize child labour issues in household decision making. Additionally, access to microfinance and training on gender and financial literacy increase financial stability and general wellbeing in households. This is expected to have a positive impact on reducing child labour in the region.Interventions include:1. Implementation of the VSLA+CHILD approach. It is based on the VSLA+GALS concept (Village Savings and Loan Associations + Gender Action Learning System). VSLA+GALS is an approach focused on: a) household financial capacity building, b) the development of household business/action plans, and c) gender empowerment. In this project, VSLA+GALS will be combined with a specific child labour remediation module (CHILD).2. As part of the VSLA+CHILD approach, participating households develop Household Development Plans, which encourage goal-setting, income diversification and financial planning.3. Child labour monitoring will take place by means of surveys and observations among participating households as well as control households to assess child labour remediation progress.The project allows local cocoa buying companies to strengthen their farmer networks, to source sustainable and traceable cocoa, and maintain excellent and long-term relationships with international buyers. For chocolate companies in the supply chain, child labour is a prominent topic. As such, the project can contribute to their efforts to eradicate child labour in their supply chains.
